Message.Title: Americans are taxed quite high to pay for out of control spending
Message.Msg: As a point of fact the U.S. is ranked 23rd in terms of the top MARGINAL tax rate among 96 countries surveyed by KPMG in 2011. However, marginal rates are not the entire story. Per the KPMG study, the Global average marginal tax rate at $100k of earnings is 28.9% with the US at 35%, which is well over the average. At an effective tax rate, level, the U.S. Has the 55th highest effective tax rate at 100k in income of 26%, and has the 53rd highest effective tax rate at 300k in income at.30.5%. It makes infinite economic sense that the effective tax rates in the U.S. should be more reasonable versus those of the rest of the world as the U.S. has the largest, most powerful, most mobile, and best spread economy of all economies in the world. It gets to the age old question, would you rather 90% of one dollar, or 20% of a thousand dollars? The idiots among us (such as the progressive left), gets enamored with the 90% figure, while the rationale fiscal thinker understands the overall superiority of the 20% figure!

Topic.Title: What is a fair share?

Message.Msg: I refer to Ray Stevens new recording. "If 10% is good enough for Jesus, It should be good enough for Uncle Sam". I've said it before, The Feds only need revenue for salary and travel, the military, foreign aid, medicare, social security and the IRS. They should be able to manage that. Every other agency or dept could be in the control of each state. Raising the amount the states can keep thru taxes would go a long way to keep them out of debt and have enough for education, healthcare, jobs, whatever is most needed. No one has the guts to propose such a sensible reform. I've written to a few reps from Calif, only response was a form e-mail thanking me for writing and a paragraph of the great things they've done. Feinstein is the most useless body in Congress. Calif is near death and she waltzes around without a care. More busnesses moving out as Gov Brown raises taxes, cuts pensions and his own throat.
